claim: The official language of Switzerland is Swiss

supporting.text: Switzerland does not have a single official language; it recognizes four national languages: German, French, Italian, and Romansh.

attacks.text: Switzerland does not have a single official language; it recognizes four national languages: German, French, Italian, and Romansh.
While Switzerland recognizes multiple languages, German is the most widely spoken and often considered the de facto official language in practice.
Even if German is widely spoken, it does not change the legal fact that Switzerland has no single official language, as confirmed by its constitution.
In some cantons, only one language is officially used, effectively making it the official language at a regional level.
Cantonal language policies do not override the federal recognition of four national languages, which applies to the country as a whole.
